messages.message:
Hey team, I've opened a 24.01-enterprise backport (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/65866/files) and cicd is failing with the below error, before it even reaches unit test suites. Any recommendations here?
```[2024-12-04T19:02:30.024Z]   Preparing metadata (setup.py): started
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   Preparing metadata (setup.py): finished with status 'error'
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   error: subprocess-exited-with-error
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   × python setup.py egg_info did not run successfully.
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   │ exit code: 1
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   ╰─> [3 lines of output]
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]       error in en_coref_md setup command: 'install_requires' must be a string or list of strings containing valid project/version requirement specifiers; Expected end or semicolon (after name and no valid version specifier)
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]           spacy>=>=2.0.0
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]                ^
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]       [end of output]
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z]   note: This error originates from a subprocess, and is likely not a problem with pip.
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z] error: metadata-generation-failed
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z] 
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z] × Encountered error while generating package metadata.
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.425Z] ╰─> See above for output.
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.726Z] make: *** [/instabase_dir/shared-utils/build-utils/shared/../../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-common.mk:43: configure-tools] Error 1
[2024-12-04T19:02:30.726Z] make: Leaving directory '/instabase_dir/shared-utils/build-utils/shared'
[2024-12-04T19:02:31.326Z] make: *** [Makefile:51: docker-pr-merge-check] Error 2```

Dealing with the same on a 23.10 backport -- I'm pretty confident we should just delete https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/release-24.01.0-enterprise/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements.base.in#L80, that dependency should be handled by services' poetry configs
There are multiple reports of this affecting 23.10 and 24.01 backports. Curious how release certification is not impacted. :open_mouth:

The dependency was first added 6 years ago: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/8298

I am wondering if the model dev can confirm if this is safe to get rid of completely

>  Curious how release certification is not impacted
I am guessing this is because this dep is only used for building the CI image.

Certification's most likely fine because we don't need to use `tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements_py37.txt` for image builds -- would be great if we could even scope the dependency to just model service, `requirements_py37.txt` has been a pain in pre-merge for some time now and iirc most of our services don't need it in the more recent releases

Yeah I can’t find any references to this package in the main repo. ibformers doesn’t seem to have any references either.
But since this predates me joining IB, I am thinking it’s safer to ask the model dev team before removing the package.
I’ll cross post it to one of their channels.
also, just to clarify, this dependency is already dropped in 24.07 onward, so it would just be removing for 24.04 - 23.10
Yeah it was dropped in this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/56241) back in April. So 24.04 is also apparently good.

Cant view the linked msg.. Did we make any progress here ?
Its blocking a lot of backports.
There are no updates on that thread yet :disappointed:

Is there anyone who I can ping to get attention on this ?
@Rakesh @Balaram would you know ?
@Hari can your team help on this?
@Sławek Biel @vineeth do you guys context on this dependency?
